availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel H. Jenkins (Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p:
Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Ann L. Jenkins.
Attorney in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1850. Member of the Democratic Party. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Ballard County from 1859 to 1863. Attorney in Ballard County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 287B-288A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 129.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Cobbs District, p. 113.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Cobbs District, p. 42B.
“Legislature,” Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), 1859-08-08, p.1.
"Samuel H. Jenkins (1821-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #135617273, accessed July 25, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135617273.
